tweet: For years, @CASAforall has worked to uplift and empower immigrant and Latino communities in Maryland. This #HispanicHeritageMonth, I am thankful for their leadership in defending immigrant communities and expanding opportunity. I’m proud to be a partner in this important work.

I join in wishing all who are celebrating Rosh Hashanah a very sweet new year for 5780.  As families gather to mark this season of transition, I hope it will usher in a year of joy, new beginnings, and new opportunities. https://bit.ly/2nKglyA
House Democrats will continue to work to protect our public lands and oppose the Trump Administration’s efforts to move public lands into private hands and roll back environmental protections.
This #NationalPublicLandsDay, I join in celebrating our county’s most treasured public areas. I also thank those who visited a national park and took part in volunteer work.

This week, the House:
✅ Worked to defend our democracy & national security,
✅ Passed border legislation to address the crisis that @POTUS created,
✅ Held hearings on the #LowerDrugCosts Now Act to make prescription drugs affordable for all. https://bit.ly/2nURS9D

Hau'oli la Hanau to my friend, @RepEdCase, an outstanding Member from #HI01. I am grateful for your work to protect our environment and public health as member of @NRDems and for your work on the @AppropsDems Committee.

¡Feliz cumpleaños @RepEspaillat! Thanks for your leadership as Whip of the @HispanicCaucus and your work on behalf of #NY13 and the nation as a member of @HouseForeign, @TransportDems, & @HouseSmallBiz.

Happy birthday to my good friend, @RepDWStweets, a tireless fighter for all in #FL23. I thank you for standing up for Venezuelans and your work to hold the Trump Admin accountable for their inhumane policies at the border.

Congress has passed a resolution overturning @POTUS’s declaration of an emergency at the border. The Admin must stop taking $ from our military & disaster preparedness & instead work with Congress to address the humanitarian catastrophe they have created. https://bit.ly/2lEKyhE

Reports that the Syrian government initiated a chlorine attack again last May is distressing & would be a clear violation of international law. The international community ought to be alarmed by the brutality of the Assad regime. https://on.wsj.com/2m6nKHJ

The U.S. was founded to be a haven for those seeking safety & a better life, it is shameful that @POTUS would close our nation’s doors to refugees. I urge the Administration to reverse this dangerous policy, which undermines our moral standing in the world https://bit.ly/2n9mHqD

Congrats to two Natl Blue Ribbon Schools in #MD05: Mount Harmony Elementary School in Owings & Saint Joseph Regional Catholic School in Beltsville. Both have demonstrated exemplary academic achievement, and I congratulate them on this honor. https://bit.ly/2m4GYO6

Today, the House passed a bill to improve medical screenings of migrant children and families so they can receive the medical care they need. I urge @senatemajldr to take up the three bills passed by the House to address the inhumane treatment of migrants at our border. https://twitter.com/LeaderHoyer/status/1176994824622366721 …

House Dems introduced the #LowerDrugCostsNow Act to bring down prescription drug prices for all Americans. I’m pleased @EnergyCommerce & @EdLaborCmte subcommittees held hearings this week to receive input from Members and the public as we advance this bill through the House. pic.twitter.com/rsvvMj7YIr

Today, @HomelandDems are holding an oversight hearing on DHS’s management of ICE facilities. The inhumane treatment of migrants seeking refuge and loss of life in ICE custody is abhorrent.  I am thankful to the Committee for continuing to conduct oversight on this issue. https://twitter.com/HomelandDems/status/1177283874738622469 …

Congratulations to @NARAL on its 50th anniversary. I am grateful for all they do & I am proud to stand with them in defending the reproductive health rights of woman in the face of unprecedented attacks. We will continue to work together to protect every woman’s right to choose.

I thank the @HouseJudiciary for holding a hearing this afternoon to examine community responses to gun violence in our cities and lift up powerful voices of those who have been affected by this epidemic. We must #EndGunViolence, and I urge the Senate GOP to take up and pass #HR8. https://twitter.com/MomsDemand/status/1177255840421699584 …

Joined @LibnOfCongress in visiting with #MD05 constituent Kelly Swanson & other MD Gold Star families. I'm pleased @LOC has expanded its Veterans History Project to include Gold Star Families so that we may remember & honor the sacrifices made by our fallen service members. pic.twitter.com/dSxzOyjjDz

After Congress unanimously demanded its release, the American people were able to see the whistleblower complaint today. The developments are deeply alarming & demand follow-up by the @HouseIntel. The House will continue to defend our Constitution. https://bit.ly/2mVRF5L

The @WaysMeansCmte is holding an important hearing on the public health consequences of gun violence in our country. House Dems are committed to ending the gun violence epidemic, and I urge the Senate to take up #HR8 and #DoSomething to keep our communities safe. https://twitter.com/WaysMeansCmte/status/1177228832853544960 …

As we consider legislation this week to improve accountability and access to medical care at the border, Dems are also continuing oversight over ICE detention facilities & the Administration’s inhumane policies. I thank @HouseJudiciary for holding a hearing on this issue today. https://twitter.com/HouseJudiciary/status/1177226447016144897 …

I also had the opportunity to welcome @BGCA_Clubs Chair Elect Carrie Schwab-Pomerantz and Board Member Andra Rush to the Capitol today. I thank them both for their work to empower young people and expand their opportunities to lead and succeed. pic.twitter.com/XYPjOizKzD

As a proud @BGCA_Clubs alumnus, I know firsthand the impact the organization has on the lives of so many young people. I was pleased to deliver remarks at this year’s annual Youth of the Year Dinner to congratulate the finalists and celebrate these youth leaders. pic.twitter.com/3iFlnLTjkz

Today, the House called for the full, unredacted report on the whistleblower complaint. @POTUS’s alarming admission that he asked the President of Ukraine to investigate one of his rivals endangers our democracy. No one is above the law in our country. https://bit.ly/2lQJO9l

The House passed a bill today to promote accountability, transparency, & oversight at the border. It is the 1st of 2 bills this week to address the crisis created by @POTUS. I urge the Senate to pass it to prevent further loss of life & inhumane treatment. https://bit.ly/2lLYG8T

The resolution put forward by @GOPLeader today is a desperate attempt by Republicans to distract from the damning memo released by the White House and President Trump’s admission that he encouraged foreign interference. This isn’t a game; it’s about safeguarding our democracy.

I thank @OversightDems for holding a hearing on how we can keep our civil service strong and recruit and retain the best and the brightest to serve the American people in the federal workforce. https://twitter.com/OversightDems/status/1176913888731901952 …

Thanks to @HouseBudgetDems for holding a hearing on the economic benefits of rebuilding our nation’s infrastructure. This remains a top priority for House Democrats, and we continue to urge @POTUS to work with us on this issue. https://twitter.com/HouseBudgetDems/status/1176867961396715520 …

Proud to bring the SAFE Banking Act to the Floor, but I believe it does not go far enough. This must be a first step toward the decriminalization & de-scheduling of marijuana. I look fwd to continuing to work w my colleagues to make progress on this issue. https://bit.ly/2lzGvTY

Happy birthday to my friend @DorisMatsui, an outstanding Member representing Sacramento. I thank you for your advocacy on environmental resiliency and mental health care as well as your leadership as Vice Chair of the @EnergyCommerce Subcommittee on Communications and Technology.

I am wishing a happy birthday to my good friend, @RepGregoryMeeks. I thank you for leading efforts to expand diversity in all sectors of the economy and for your work as Chair of the @FSCDems Subcommittee on Consumer Protections & Financial Institutions.
Thank you @RepDavidTrone for your leadership in this issue https://twitter.com/RepDavidTrone/status/1176649799438876675 …

I continue to stand with my colleagues, including @NRDems who are advancing several ocean climate bills today, and the American people who are calling for #OceanClimateAction. I urge the GOP Senate to pass the #ClimateActionNow Act. pic.twitter.com/9hqYW0UShD

The major climate report by the @IPCC_CH only further illustrates what is at stake if we do not #ActOnClimate. Our oceans, coastal communities, and marine ecosystems are suffering from the dangerous heat of climate change. https://twitter.com/IPCC_CH/status/1176790706830086145 …

The memorandum released by the White House this morning is damning. It is a striking abdication of POTUS’s responsibility to put the security and integrity of our country first, instead putting his own personal interests first. https://bit.ly/2lyWr92
Lastly, I told press that the House is advancing the #LowerDrugCostsNow Act with two subcommittee hearings this week. The House is working to #LowerDrugCostsNow #ForThePeople.
I also said the House will vote on two border bills this week to ensure accountability and oversight at our border and improve medical screenings so children and families can get the care they need.

I told press that the House will vote on a resolution this afternoon to demand the full release of the whistleblower complaint, and I hope that House Republicans will join us in supporting this resolution as Republican Senators did.

I started my weekly press conference by voicing my support for Congress moving forward with an official impeachment inquiry. I also said the memo released by the White House is damning evidence that POTUS sought foreign interference ahead of 2020.
The House will vote on a resolution regarding the whistleblower complaint today. View my full statement with @SpeakerPelosi here: https://bit.ly/2lHgGRR

Today, I am wearing purple & standing alongside my colleagues to support National #RecoveryMonth. We must raise awareness on mental health & substance abuse, support those who are struggling with it, and work to #EndTheStigma. Resources can be found here:  https://www.samhsa.gov/find-treatment  pic.twitter.com/FTWN6uVzeG
I fully support Congress moving forward with an official impeachment inquiry. Read my full statement here: https://bit.ly/2mx7uPS
The House will vote on a resolution regarding whistleblower subpoenas tomorrow. View my full statement with @SpeakerPelosi here: https://bit.ly/2msXB5R

The right to vote is our most fundamental right, and House Democrats are working to ensure every eligible American can exercise that right. On #NationalVoterRegistrationDay, I encourage Americans to register to vote and ensure their voice is heard. https://nationalvoterregistrationday.org/

In 2018, the @uscensusbureau found that 11.9 million children lived in poverty. We must redouble efforts to #EndChildPoverty. The Majority Leader Task Force on Poverty & Opportunity will continue to protect proven anti-poverty programs & resist Admin's efforts to take them away. pic.twitter.com/fITK8kk61m

While @POTUS has isolated the U.S. in the global effort to address the #ClimateCrisis, the majority of Americans demand action. House Dems commend those who are announcing action at the #ClimateActionSummit & we continue to call on @senatemajldr to pass the #ClimateActionNow Act. https://twitter.com/UNFCCC/status/1176131402582188032 …

I remain deeply concerned with how the Administration is treating immigrant communities, including its termination of the #DACA program. I continue to call on the Senate to pass #HR6 to protect #Dreamers, and I urge Dreamers to renew their status today:  https://bit.ly/2mCabwI

This #HispanicHeritageMonth, I join in celebrating the service & contributions of immigrants. I'm proud that my father came to this country from Denmark & served in the Armed Forces. House Dems will continue to stand with immigrants & lift up their contributions to our nation.

Today is #NativeWomensEqualPay Day, when we recognize the vast pay inequity that Native women face. House Dems passed the #PaycheckFairness Act in March, and I call on @senatemajldr to allow a vote now so we can ensure #EqualPay. pic.twitter.com/c7cUv9InBs

Happy birthday to my friend representing #FL05, @RepAlLawsonJr. Thank you for your decades of public service and for your commitment to civil rights, affordable health care, preventing gun violence, ending hunger & college affordability.

Wishing a happy birthday to my friend, @RepMalinowski. Thank you for dedicating your career to fighting for human rights around the globe and bringing that expertise to Congress as a Member of @HouseForeign Affairs Committee.
Today, I am wishing all across the country a happy #AutumnEquinox, and I look forward to joining #MD05 residents in enjoying the beauty of Maryland in the fall. pic.twitter.com/Nkdy1arOZb

Wishing a happy birthday to my friend and fellow Marylander, @davidjtrone. I thank you for your work on the @EdLaborCmte and @HouseForeign Committees and your leadership in the fight against opioid abuse.

I’m wishing a happy birthday to my friend, @RepJayapal, an outstanding Member from #WA07. Thank you for your work as Co-Chair of the @USProgressives and for being a strong defender for immigrant families and communities.

Proud to be at the @CHCI reception last night to recognize the contributions of Hispanic Americans. I thank the @HispanicCaucus for their leadership, and and I will continue to fight with them to ensure equality and opportunity for all Americans. pic.twitter.com/eJObOEAkBC
I will continue to work alongside my colleagues in Congress to fight back against their punitive treatment of migrants, which runs counter to our nation’s values.

DHS made the right decision to reverse its inhumane plan to deport sick migrant children receiving medical care and their families. However, I remain deeply concerned by their cruel anti-immigrant agenda. https://nbcnews.to/2mpMFWK

This week the House:
✅ Passed a bill to extend govt funding,
✅ Passed the FAIR Act to protect American consumers & workers,
✅ Stood with those participating in #ClimateStrikes & called on the Senate to #ActOnClimate. https://bit.ly/2ko3G2K
As we recognize this anniversary, I continue to call on the Senate to take up the #EqualityAct, which we passed earlier this year to expand #LGBTQ protections.

It has been 8 years since the discriminatory Don’t Ask Don’t Tell policy was repealed, allowing #LGBTQ Americans to serve openly in the Armed Forces. I was proud to bring legislation to repeal #DADT to the House Floor, and House Dems continue to stand up for LGBTQ rights. pic.twitter.com/c0bhxmwkBD

I thank @GretaThunberg for her remarkable leadership in organizing the #ClimateStrike that has mobilized young people around the country and the world to bring attention to the urgency of climate change and call for much-needed action. #FridaysForFutures pic.twitter.com/uSy7GVMjue

I urge @realDonaldTrump to listen to the majority of Americans who believe the #ClimateCrisis is real and must be addressed. There is so much at stake, and the public deserves leadership that prioritizes their concern. RT to tell @POTUS: it’s time for #ClimateAction now. pic.twitter.com/opSCkr9NJh

It is shameful that the Trump Administration is aggressively rolling back public health and environmental protections. @POTUS must reverse course and work with Congress to #ActOnClimate. I also call on @senatemajldr to take up the #ClimateActionNow Act. pic.twitter.com/J5voXZ5a09

Today, young people around the world are holding a #ClimateStrike to demand action on the #ClimateCrisis. I am inspired by their activism and stand in solidarity with them. House Dems have passed a number of bills to #ActOnClimate. We will continue to work to address this crisis. pic.twitter.com/bOYZo6UmDz

We will continue to conduct oversight and take action to ensure a full recovery in the aftermath of Hurricane Maria. We are also focused on the #ClimateCrisis that is causing more severe and frequent storms. We will continue to #ActOnClimate. #2YearsAfterMaria pic.twitter.com/OGJj3ActO9

It is shameful that #2YearsAfterMaria, there are still over 30,000 damaged homes w blue tarps, power outages are still frequent, & the govt estimates that the recovery may take 15-18 years. House Dems will hold this Administration accountable for its failed recovery efforts. pic.twitter.com/KpmDyqFJn4

It's been 2 years since #HurricaneMaria struck #PuertoRico & #USVI, causing nearly 3,000 deaths, devastating damage, & the longest blackout in American history. Dems continue to stand with #OurFellowAmericans & will work to ensure they can rebuild even stronger. #2YearsAfterMaria pic.twitter.com/aFo90GkaYe

The Majority Leader Task Force on Poverty and Opportunity met today to oppose the Admin’s efforts to take food away from those who need it and make 500,000 children ineligible for school lunch programs. We will continue working to ensure Americans are not harmed by these actions. pic.twitter.com/TYOZrr5F41

I was saddened to learn of Emily England Clyburn’s passing. I had the privilege of knowing her for many years and saw the true partnership she and @WhipClyburn shared. Her passing is a terrible loss for SC, where she had a dedicated career of service. https://bit.ly/2kGzRe9
This bill not only memorializes a wonderful human being but will also benefit the FIRST program and encourage youth STEM activities.

Today, I spoke in support of the Christa McAuliffe Commemorative Coin Act, a bill named after my dear friend. Christa was a teacher who was devoted to our country, her community, and our children. She was the best of us, as were her fellow astronauts. pic.twitter.com/jadIh9WY5y

Today, the House passed a bipartisan continuing resolution to fund government and health programs through November 21. I urge the Senate to use this time to work with us to develop bipartisan funding bills that can be signed into law. We can get the job done. pic.twitter.com/byctjmYwad
I was proud to be there today to join you and many others to #StandUp4DC and urge Congress to pass DC statehood. https://twitter.com/MayorBowser/status/1174702160484995073 …
Thank you for watching today and your advocacy for #DCStatehood.

Appreciated the opportunity to discuss my support for #DCStatehood at @OversightDems’ hearing with my good friend @EleanorNorton. We must work to ensure 700,000 of our fellow Americans have equal representation in Congress.  https://bit.ly/2lZuJls  pic.twitter.com/ArNybSQjq4

I thank @TransportDems for holding a markup today on important legislation to improve the health of the #ChesapeakeBay. We must continue to fight to #SaveTheBay and its tributaries. https://twitter.com/TransportDems/status/1174689831932387329 …

A pressing challenge facing working families is the out-of-control cost of prescription drugs, and House Dems are preparing to introduce #HR3, the #LowerDrugCosts Now Act, to lower prices #ForThePeople.  https://bit.ly/2lXLbCO  pic.twitter.com/vr6jmGw5lA

I’m joining @EleanorNorton today at the #DCStatehood hearing to discuss my strong support for #DCStatehood. Watch my remarks here:  https://bit.ly/2kVpfIn  https://twitter.com/EleanorNorton/status/1173651655038033920 …

I am wishing a happy birthday to my friend, @RepCuellar. Thank you for your work on behalf of all in #TX28. Our caucus values your leadership as Chief Deputy Whip and your work on @AppropsDems to bring jobs, economic opportunity, and development to the border region.

Glad to join MD Chapter of @MilitaryOfficer to thank our vets for their service to our nation & for their work advocating for service members. I’m proud to represent many men and women in uniform in #MD05, & will continue to work to keep our installations strong. pic.twitter.com/r4eUtj1T2S

This @sandyhook PSA is a powerful reminder of the reality of gun violence in our country and the lives at stake. It is long past time for action. I stand with the majority of Americans in calling on @senatemajldr to pass #HR8 and #DoSomething to #EndGunViolence. https://twitter.com/sandyhook/status/1174291982857883653 …

Thank you to everyone who called into my telephone town hall last night. It was great to speak with #MD05 constituents about the issues most important to them, including climate change, the cost of prescription drugs, oversight of the Trump Administration, and affordable housing. pic.twitter.com/p3GcVDxEoT

Lastly, I said that the majority of Americans believe climate change is a major crisis. House Democrats oppose the President’s anti-environment agenda, have passed legislation to address the #ClimateCrisis, and will take up additional bills to #ActOnClimate.

I also told press that this week the House will pass the FAIR Act, which would eliminate forced arbitration in employment, consumer, and civil rights cases. It’s good for consumers and workers, and I hope the Senate will take it up after it passes the House.

At my weekly press conference, I told press that the Senate has done nothing to fund the government, so the House will vote on a CR this week to extend government funding through November 21. I’m hopeful we'll reach agreement on the CR and can vote on it on Thursday or Friday.

The @EPA’s dirty water agenda put’s the drinking water of 1/3 Americans at risk, threatening communities and families who rely on clean and safe water. House Dems are fighting to #ProtectOurWater and safeguard against @EPAAWheeler and @POTUS’s #DirtyWaterRule. pic.twitter.com/d5pLoKJyqe

I thank @BennieGThompson for his leadership on the Domestic & International Terrorism DATA Act, which the House will vote on. This bill would strengthen homeland security by providing a full picture of domestic & international terrorist threats we face. https://bit.ly/2kRwaSH

I applaud the success of this year’s @CBCFInc Annual Legislative Conference. I am proud of the @TheBlackCaucus Members who held sessions to address important issues on equality and opportunity. View some of our photos here:  https://bit.ly/2kmDAxf

This #ConstitutionDay & #CitizenshipDay, we commemorate the signing of the Constitution and recognize those who have become citizens. Let us recommit to upholding the Constitution, ensuring all Americans can exercise their right to vote, and fix our broken immigration system. pic.twitter.com/cbpCTdb7X6

Joined my colleagues in a letter to @SecretarySonny urging him to reconsider proposed changes to SNAP, which would force 50,000 of Maryland’s most vulnerable residents to lose access to benefits. https://bit.ly/2kRUSCD
I'll continue working with NFFF to honor the fallen by supporting their families and by also working to ensure our nation’s firefighters have the resources to do their jobs safely and effectively.

As Co-Chair of the Congressional Fire Services Caucus, I joined @NFFF_News in honoring the service and sacrifice of our fallen firefighters. This year, we honored three Marylanders we lost in 2018: Nathan Flynn, Christopher Pryor, and Danny Lister. pic.twitter.com/AkDz48LTyP

I was deeply saddened to learn of the passing of my dear friend Cokie Roberts. She was a wonderful person and a trailblazer for women in journalism. Her memory will be a blessing and an inspiration to all who were fortunate to know her. https://bit.ly/2lSNVS2

This #HispanicHeritageMonth, I stand with @RepDMP and the @HispanicCaucus Women’s Task Force in the fight for economic justice, health care, and equality for all women. Hispanic women face inequities that must be addressed, and we are united in ending those disparities. pic.twitter.com/HpULMrhSA6

The attack on Saudi oil facilities is not only an attack on Saudi Arabia but on the stability of the world economy. We do not yet know who perpetrated this attack, but whoever did ought to suffer consequences after a proper investigation of what happened. https://bit.ly/2mn9han
Wishing my good friend, @RepStephMurphy, a happy birthday today. I thank her for her strong and critically important leadership as Co-Chair of @HouseBlueDogs.

Happy birthday to my friend @JoaquinCastrotx of #TX20. I thank you for your outstanding leadership as Chair of the @HispanicCaucus and for your efforts to expand access to education and opportunity as a member of @EdLaborCmte.

As we celebrate #HispanicHeritageMonth, we must also redouble our efforts to safeguard #VotingRights, make sure everyone is counted in the #2020Census, and ensure the voices of all Hispanic communities are heard.

I am proud that the 116th Congress is the most diverse in our nation’s history, and it is an honor to serve with our largest @HispanicCaucus ever. We are united to fighting for Hispanic communities and defending our values against the immoral policies of the Trump Administration.

I join in wishing everyone in #MD05 and across the country a very happy and meaningful #HispanicHeritageMonth, a time to uplift and celebrate the pride, patriotism, accomplishments, and contributions of Hispanic communities. pic.twitter.com/aDYTDBgXk1

In August, Sylvia’s sister, Dr. Wendy Edmonds, joined House Dems to call on @senatemajldr to bring #HR8, the Bipartisan Background Checks Act, to the Senate Floor. Too many lives have been senselessly lost to gun violence. We cannot wait. I call on the Senate GOP to #DoSomething. pic.twitter.com/wkXyjQt9s9

As we remember the 6th anniversary of the shooting at the Washington Navy Yard, my thoughts are with the loved ones of the 12 individuals killed, including #MD05 constituents Kenneth Proctor, Frank Kohler, and Sylvia Frasier.

56 years ago, the 16th Street Baptist Church Bombing took the lives of 4 African American girls: Addie Mae Collins, Cynthia Wesley,Carole Robertson, & Denise McNair. As we mourn them & continue to fight for equality for all Americans, let us stand united against racism & hate.

Happy birthday to my good friend, @RepEscobar - a rock and strong advocate for the El Paso community in the midst of a tumultuous year. You are a tough defender for migrants and it shows in your efforts to address the humanitarian crisis at the southern border.

Wishing my friend, @RepBarragan, a happy birthday today. Thank you for your work to reform our broken immigration system as member of @HomelandDems and for being a steadfast advocate for all in #CA44.
I am proud to serve with the Congressional @HispanicCaucus, and we will continue to fight for equality, opportunity, and justice for all.

This #HispanicHeritageMonth is an opportunity to celebrate the innumerable contributions and the service of Hispanic Americans to our nation. As we mark this occasion, we must also stand united against the Admin’s dangerous and dehumanizing anti-immigrant policies. pic.twitter.com/mwmJTDd9LQ

Great to join in worship with my good friends Bishop Joel & Pastor Ylawnda Peebles at @CityOfPraiseMD in Landover this morning. I enjoyed our fellowship with many #MD05 families. pic.twitter.com/TtuD0GFbPd
I had a great time @RepAndreCarson’s #CBCFALC19 on Hip Hop and Politics. Thanks for having me! pic.twitter.com/In7cmn4rZz

@RepUnderwood has been a strong advocate for maternal health care, and I’m proud to be part of the Black Maternal Health Caucus. I thank her for her dedication to addressing disparities in maternal health care and holding a #CBCFALC19 panel on this issue. pic.twitter.com/LyallANAuP

I thank @RepLBR for her #CBCFALC19 panel: The Future of Work: Disruption or Innovation: A Blueprint for the Black Community in the Tech Age. It was an important and informative conversation. pic.twitter.com/QU4e6BwgGx
It was great to attend @JacksonLeeTX18’s Energy Issue Forum at #CBCFALC19 and meet Pepper the Robot. I thank her for her leadership on this issue. pic.twitter.com/N0LsdxNONw

Always proud to support my good friend & fighter for justice & human rights,@RepBarbaraLee. I thank her for her leadership as Chair of the Majority Leader Task Force on Poverty & Opportunity & look forward to our work to address poverty & ensure families can #MakeItInAmerica. pic.twitter.com/UtddhtnkrQ
As House Dems fight to #ProtectTheDream, I want to remind DACA recipients to renew their status today: https://bit.ly/2mCabwI
As we enter Hispanic Heritage month this weekend, House Democrats remain committed to ensuring that #Dreamers can continue to contribute to the country they love and call home.

Happy birthday to Vice Chair of @USProgressives and my friend, @RepRoKhanna. We value your leadership as Assistant Whip and your strong leadership in taking a stand against U.S. involvement in the war in Yemen and advocating for peace.

Happy birthday to my friend @RepRichmond. Thank you for your advocacy on behalf of all communities in #LA02, your leadership as a subcommittee Chairman on @HomelandDems, your services as Assistant Whip, & the countless strikeouts as our starting pitcher.

Nearly half of Americans believe that action must be taken to mitigate the #ClimateCrisis. Instead of rolling back environmental protections & withdrawing from the Paris Climate Accord, @POTUS must listen to the American people who want #ClimateAction. https://bit.ly/2lNBqHg

For 25 years, #VAWA has helped stamp out domestic abuse, violence against women and girls, and sexual harassment and provide victims and survivors with the resources to recover and seek justice. #VAWA25 https://bit.ly/2mf5z2r

Pleased to speak at a reception today to commemorate @BowieState and Millennium Corporation’s public-private partnership. I look forward to continuing to work with @PresBreaux and the Bowie State community to expand opportunity for students. pic.twitter.com/mM9pXIa39R

Great to attend my good friend @RepTerriSewell’s reception tonight and celebrate her hard work in Congress and dedication to voting rights. I look forward to continuing to work alongside her and our colleagues in @TheBlackCaucus. pic.twitter.com/62A3y7MPnb

Proud to be a #wildlife champion with my colleagues. House Democrats will continue work to #ProtectTheArctic. https://twitter.com/Defenders/status/1172207011716575233 …
I will continue to fight on behalf of families that are put in harm's way because of the Administration’s #DirtyWaterRule. House Democrats will continue to fight for clean air and water.
Thank you for your work and activism. House Democrats were proud to pass H.R. 1146 today to #ProtectTheArctic.

Today, the Admin will finalize its #DirtyWaterRule, which ends protections that keep water clean for 1/3 of Americans. I urge @POTUS to stop weakening enviro & public health safeguards. House Dems will continue to work to #ProtectCleanWater for all. https://nyti.ms/2kyuJbZ

Proud that the House passed a bill to #ProtectTheArctic from oil and gas drilling, which would put this vulnerable ecosystem & the livelihoods of the Gwich'in people at risk. We are committed to protecting #ANWR & continuing to #ActOnClimate. I urge the Senate to pass this bill. pic.twitter.com/3VaZQjD5BO

I join in celebrating the 25th anniversary of @AmeriCorps, a remarkably successful program that promotes volunteerism to help build stronger communities. I look forward to continuing to support AmeriCorps & its work in the Congress in the years ahead. https://bit.ly/2lKghhh

Glad to see Jamie Roberts’ legacy live on and inspire future generations w the opening of @StMarysMD’s new stadium, which is named in her memory. She will be remembered as a kind person, an outstanding athlete, & a wonderful friend to many. #LiveLikeJamie https://bit.ly/2lO1AJV
If you need help with a federal agency, don’t wait to contact my office. For more information, visit my website by clicking here: https://hoyer.house.gov/help/federal

Roosevelt R., a veteran from Waldorf, contacted my office regarding his years long struggle to get retroactive benefits owed to him from @DeptVetAffairs. After making inquiries on his behalf, the VA recently paid him the more than $77,000 he was due. pic.twitter.com/6lPaELPshf
Did you know that my office can help #MD05 constituents with issues related to federal agencies? From help with @SocialSecurity to @DeptVetAffairs and @DHSgov, my staff and I are here to help.

The Admin’s policy of turning away desperate and frightened families is cruel. I disagree with the #SCOTUS decision to allow the asylum ban to be implemented. I hope courts will uphold our asylum laws & ensure that America remains a beacon of hope. https://bit.ly/2kd06sd

It is outrageous that @POTUS will not provide TPS status to Bahamians fleeing the devastation of Hurricane Dorian. It will take time to rebuild. I urge POTUS to reconsider this decision and provide Bahamians with the opportunity to live & work here until it is safe to return. https://twitter.com/TheBlackCaucus/status/1171901285232238595 …

It was great to meet with new @HRC President & fellow Terp, @AlphonsoDavid. House Democrats share HRC’s commitment to standing up for the LGBTQ community and ensuring equal rights and protections. I thank him for his leadership and look forward to working together. pic.twitter.com/0Lf0afGeuU

Proud to bring 3 bills to the Floor that block oil and gas drilling in #ANWR, the Atlantic and Pacific Coasts, and the Gulf of Mexico. Instead of doubling down on fossil fuels, we must #ProtectOurCoasts and arctic ecosystems, #ActOnClimate, & develop clean energy technologies. pic.twitter.com/hvrYOsvSLl

I was proud to bring legislation to the Floor to enact a permanent reauthorization of the #911VCF. That bipartisan effort will ensure that those who continue to suffer health effects from the attacks & those who lost loved-ones will always be watched over by a grateful nation.

Today marks 18 years since the horrific attacks of 9/11. As we mourn those lost, let us pay tribute to the heroes who responded and who deployed far overseas in defense of our nation in the years since.  https://bit.ly/2k86zoe  pic.twitter.com/8HeDkVdknQ

.@POTUS touts economic success under his policies, but a look at new reports show those policies are causing real harm: 
❌Manufacturing contracted for the first time in 3 years.
❌Wages for workers are stagnant.
❌The number of uninsured rose. 
Read more: https://bit.ly/2lLTRw5

Lastly, I discussed the state of the economy under Trump: manufacturing has contracted, wages are stagnant, & the # of uninsured has risen. The House has acted to #RaiseTheWage, ensure #EqualPayforEqualWork, and protect workers' pensions. I urge Senate GOP to pass those bills.

I also expressed my deep concern that @POTUS is stealing funds from military construction & disaster relief efforts to build his ineffective border wall that he said Mexico would fund. That is not what the Constitution envisioned nor is it what the American voter envisioned.
I told press we will also consider a short-term CR to fund government beyond September 30 to avoid a shutdown and give the Senate additional time to do its work and pass appropriations bills

At my weekly press conference, I told press the House will vote this week on 3 bills to block oil & gas drilling in ANWR, the Atlantic and Pacific Coasts, and in the Eastern Gulf of Mexico. These reflect our deep concern about the #ClimateCrisis. We’ll continue to #ActOnClimate

Dems continue to urge the Senate GOP to take up #HR8. Last night, @HouseJudiciary advanced additional legislation to take further action to #EndGunViolence. I thank @RepJerryNadler & the Committee for their work & urge the Senate to #DoSomething. https://bit.ly/2lQ5r9b

I strongly support Chairman Nadler and the Judiciary Committee Democrats as they proceed with their investigation “to determine whether to recommend articles of impeachment to the full House,” as the resolution states. My full statement:  https://bit.ly/2lJiTfi  pic.twitter.com/XlQ8syiMKS
I thank @SABraveboy & community leaders in College Park for holding an important discussion tonight on criminal justice issues facing Prince George’s County. https://bit.ly/2kD76yR

Proud of #MD05’s own Emmie for earning the K-9 Medal of Courage today. Thank you for your service, Emmie. I also want to thank @AmericanHumane for your leading role in supporting veterans and service dogs over the years. pic.twitter.com/t298UO39nN

Today, on #WorldSuicidePreventionDay, I join my friend, @RepMarkTakano, in calling for a VA stand-down so that all VA employees have the resources and training to help veterans. We must #BeThere for all veterans in crisis. pic.twitter.com/X8yABYi5sB
If you or someone you know is in need of assistance, please call the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline: 1-800-273-8255. RT to share.
On #WorldSuicidePreventionDay, we must recommit ourselves to eliminating the stigma surrounding mental health and ensure Americans are able to access the care and treatment they need.

I thank @RepKarenBass & @TheBlackCaucus for holding an event today to commemorate the first recorded forced arrival of enslaved African people to this country in 1619. #400YearsLater, we must confront our history and work to end the disparities that continue to persist. pic.twitter.com/feMY0ALNEI

Deeply concerned by reports of corruption at FEMA at a time when Puerto Rico endured the longest blackout in American history. #OurFellowAmericans deserve better. I will continue to monitor this to ensure those guilty of wrongdoing are held accountable. https://nyti.ms/2lJqfiK

Whoever replaces Mr. Bolton ought to be someone who approaches our national security challenges with strategy and care, someone who understands the importance of working closely with the Congress, and someone who isn’t afraid to say “no” to the President when he is wrong.
While I am relieved that John Bolton will no longer be at the President’s ear, I continue to be deeply concerned by the chaos and dysfunction of this White House. https://bit.ly/2lGRdYu

Today, @HouseSmallBiz is looking at expanding the role of small businesses within the clean energy economy. Americans around the country are still experiencing voting discrimination and obstacles at the ballot box. This must end, and I thank @HouseJudiciary for addressing this issue at today's hearing. I thank @FSCDems for their commitment to addressing the student debt crisis. Today, they are holding a hearing on this issue and are focused on ensuring student borrowers are not taken advantage of by student loan servicers. https://twitter.com/FSCDems/status/1171430415451615232 …

Deeply moved by my friend @RepSusanWild’s decision to share her story & advocate for mental health care and suicide prevention. Susan, your colleagues stand with you as you mourn your loss & give voice to Americans affected by the tragedy of suicide. https://wapo.st/2knQAml
Proud to join @RepCindyAxne in her district last week to discuss how we can ensure more workers and their families can #MakeItInAmerica. https://twitter.com/RepCindyAxne/status/1170028501795311616 …

Pleased to announce more than $415,000 in grants for #MD05 fire departments. The funds will allow local departments to purchase new equipment and ensure our firefighters have access to the tools they need to do their jobs safely. https://bit.ly/2kbADiY
I congratulate all of our winners and finalists and encourage all Members to continue prioritizing digital communications throughout the year.

Proud to announce the subcategory winners for House Dems’ annual Online All-Star Competition. I am so impressed by the creative ways our Members are utilizing social media to keep the public informed about the vital work we are doing in the House. https://bit.ly/2k4jMyx
Wishing a happy birthday to new Member, @RepSylviaGarcia, who proudly serves #TX29. Thank you for your work on the @HouseJudiciary Subcommittee on the Constitution, Civil Rights and Civil Liberties.

Happy birthday to my friend, @RepDannyDavis. Thank you for being a strong fighter for families in #IL07 and across the country as Chair of the Worker and Family Support Subcommittee on the @WaysMeansCmte.

Happy birthday to my friend, @USRepKeating, a committed Member for all in #MA09. Thank you for your leadership on national security and foreign policy as Chair of the Europe, Eurasia, Energy, and Environment subcommittee on @HouseForeign.

House Dems have passed legislation to raise wages, ensure equal pay for women, protect and expand health coverage, and protect the pensions of millions of American workers.  This autumn we will continue to deliver on our promises #ForThePeople.

Today’s jobs report is a reminder that @POTUS’s policies are putting our economy at risk. Job gains under-performed expectations, wages continue to stagnate, and our manufacturing sector has contracted as a result of the Admin’s trade policies. https://bit.ly/2kmfCSU

Joined my #MD colleagues in sending a letter to Congressional appropriators urging them to ensure critical upgrades are made to @NIH in Bethesda. We must ensure NIH has the resources needed to conduct its critically important mission. https://bit.ly/2m1dksK
Wishing my friend, @RepHastingsFL, a happy birthday today. Thank you for your service as a champion for civil rights and as Vice Chair of @RulesDemocrats.

Happy birthday to my good friend and advocate for all families in the Granite State, @RepAnnieKuster. Thank you for your efforts to address the opioid epidemic as founder and Co-Chair of the Heroin and Opioid Task Force and as a member of @EnergyCommerce.

House Dems will keep fighting to prevent this President from using taxpayer and military resources to build a wall. We will stand up for our men and women in uniform, who are being put at risk by this decision and deserve better from their commander-in-chief.

Happy birthday to my friend, @RepGonzalez. Thank you for your work to support U.S.–Mexico relations as a member of @HouseForeign Committee and for advocating on behalf of small businesses in #TX15 as a member of @FSCDems.

Glad to join my colleagues in announcing funding for @UofMaryland & @MorganStateU to promote entrepreneurship and increase long-term competitiveness & economic diversification in our region. https://bit.ly/2lA5rdk

In the first 200 days of our Majority, the Democratic-led House has passed the #RaiseTheWage Act, the #PaycheckFairness Act, & the Butch Lewis Act. I call on the GOP-led Senate to pass these bills to ensure the American Dream remains in reach for all those who work hard.

Happy birthday to my friend, @RepAlGreen. We thank you for fighting for justice, for your advocacy on behalf of all in #TX09, and for your work as a member of @FSCDems.

I urge the Senate to have the courage to pass commonsense gun legislation passed by the House and supported by the majority of Americans. The American people are calling for action, and it is far past time for the GOP Senate to #DoSomething. https://bit.ly/2MNZSVf

I am horrified that yet another mass shooting has taken lives and injured fellow Americans in Texas. My prayers are with the communities of Midland and Odessa, and I thank the law enforcement officials and first responders on the ground for their swift action.
